benchmark_details.name: HATEBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: HATEBENCH is a framework for benchmarking hate speech detectors on LLM-generated content, consisting of a dataset generated by six large language models covering 34 identity groups and meticulously annotated.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the effectiveness of hate speech detectors against LLM-generated content and reveal the robustness of these detectors in counteracting LLM-driven hate campaigns.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Detectors demonstrate weak robustness against evolving LLMs and adversarial attacks.

data.source: HATEBENCH SET, generated by six LLMs and manually annotated.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by three labelers with an inter-agreement of Krippendorff's Alpha = 0.846.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated using standard classification evaluation metrics.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance of hate speech detectors.
methodology.baseline_results: Perspective F1-score: 0.878 on GPT-3.5; drops to 0.621 on GPT-4.
methodology.validation: Results are based on assessing eight representative hate speech detectors.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis was conducted on different identity groups within the dataset.
harm: Potential psychological and emotional harm due to automated hate speech generation.
